author: silecrypto
content: Hello, not sure where to post Noob questions. What will be the block size in ETH 2.0? I've read the max block size is 15m gas (1.875mb) per ETH 1 block.

author: ralexstokes
content:
<#672059911034634243> may be a better place but:

the average block size is dictated by EIP-1559 mechanics so that the max block size is what it was going into the 1559 deployment of 30M gas. the avg. block size is just half of this so block producers target a block size of 15M gas to keep the base fee around where it currently is

author: ralexstokes
content: you could look at gas pricing and find a best case and worst case size in bytes, don't know off the top of my head but i usually assume it will approximately follow a recent average and you can see data here: https://etherscan.io/chart/blocksize (so 80-90kb per block)
